display_name: Breast Cancer Biomarker Testing by Provider
cohort: Breast Cancer Biomarker Testing, by Provider (2024–2025)
summary: Provider variation in breast cancer biomarker testing: Dr. Martinez tests 97% of standard markers, but emerging biomarkers like PIK3CA and BRCA1/2 show lower adoption across providers.

financial_impact.math: $165,000/year = 8% testing gap (lagging providers) × 75 breast cancer patients × $27,500 precision therapy value

clinical_impact.description: Standardizing breast cancer biomarker testing across providers improves therapy selection and outcomes.

metrics.description: Improved progression-free survival with matched therapies
Overall survival benefit with biomarker-guided treatment
Higher objective response rate with matched therapies

peer_comparison.description: Leading breast oncologists achieve >95% comprehensive biomarker testing rates, particularly with expanded molecular testing.

financial_impact.math: $210,000/year = $165,000 direct therapy value + $45,000 clinical trial enrollment

action_steps.text: Standardize expanded biomarker protocols across all providers
Develop PIK3CA testing pathway for all HR+ metastatic cases
Implement standardized PIK3CA testing protocol for HR+/HER2-
Schedule provider education on emerging breast biomarkers
Develop EMR-based expanded biomarker testing alert

suggestions.text: Evaluate provider understanding of PIK3CA clinical utility
